key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs priced 96.79% of itineraries below SATA Air Açores’s website last week, delivering an average fare discount of 0.16%.
MSE undercut the airline website on 99.36% of itineraries last week, yielding an average price gap of –0.23%.
GDS fares were lower on 97.44% of itineraries last week, with a consistent average discount of 0.16%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTAs priced 96.79% of itineraries below the website last week, with an average fare discount of 0.16%.
The share of discounted fares edged down 0.17 pp week-over-week and 1.56 pp month-over-month, indicating a consistent OTA advantage.
Both short-haul and PT-origin markets mirror overall OTA discounts, while close-in and far-out bookings see 95.12% and 98.65% lower fares, respectively.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 3.21% of itineraries lacked OTA offers last week, up 0.17 pp from the prior week and 1.56 pp from the prior month.
No instances of price parity between the website and OTA channel were recorded in the latest week.
OTAs did not list higher fares than the website in any analyzed itineraries last week.
96.79% of itineraries were cheaper on OTAs last week, reflecting the dominant pricing position of the channel.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 96.79% of short-haul itineraries on OTAs were priced below the website last week, matching the overall channel rate with a 0.16% average discount.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Portugal origin itineraries, 96.79% were cheaper on OTAs last week, with the average OTA discount holding at 0.16%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95.12% of close-in bookings were cheaper on OTAs last week, delivering an average fare discount of 0.17%.
98.65% of far-out bookings saw OTA fares below the website, with a 0.15% average discount and full offer coverage month-over-month.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE fares undercut the airline website on 99.36% of itineraries last week, reflecting a strong pricing advantage.
MSE lower-fare frequency dipped only 0.03 pp versus the prior week and 0.64 pp versus last month, indicating pricing stability.
There were zero cases of MSE fares exceeding the airline’s website, underscoring a one-sided discount trend.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.64% of itineraries matched website prices last week, up marginally by 0.03 pp week-over-week and 0.64 pp month-over-month.
99.36% of itineraries were cheaper on MSE last week, with an average price gap of –0.23% and negligible week (–0.03 pp) and month (–0.64 pp) shifts.
No itineraries showed MSE fares above the website in any period.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored the all-market trend with 99.36% lower-fare frequency and a –0.23% average discount last week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All Portugal-origin itineraries saw MSE discounts 99.36% of the time, with a stable –0.23% price differential.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For bookings within a week of departure, 100% of fares were cheaper on MSE last week, widening slightly by 1.14 pp versus the prior week and offering a –0.24% average discount.
For bookings made more than a week ahead, MSE held a 100% lower-fare rate with a –0.22% average price gap and no week-over-week change.

gds_highlights.line_content: Last week 97.44% of GDS fares were lower than the airline’s website, indicating a strong pricing advantage in the GDS channel.
The proportion of itineraries with lower GDS fares rose by 0.47 pp week-over-week and 0.73 pp month-over-month.
GDS fares averaged 0.16% below website rates across last week, previous week, and previous month, showing stable discounting.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS LOWER status applied to 97.44% of itineraries last week, up from 96.97% week-over-week and 96.70% month-over-month, reflecting expanding discount presence.
2.56% of itineraries were not found on GDS last week, down 0.47 pp week-over-week and 0.73 pp month-over-month, indicating improved content coverage.
No itineraries were priced the same on GDS versus the website in the latest week, signaling clear price differentiation.
GDS did not show any higher fares than the website last week, highlighting exclusively lower or missing price instances.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored the overall trend with 97.44% of itineraries priced lower last week and an average discount of 0.16% versus website rates.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All itineraries originating in Portugal saw 97.44% lower fares on GDS last week, with the average GDS discount steady at 0.16%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For last-minute itineraries, 96.34% were cheaper on GDS last week—up 0.94 pp week-over-week—with an average 0.17% discount.
For bookings made far in advance, 98.65% had lower GDS fares last week, a slight decrease of 1.35 pp from the prior week, with an average 0.15% discount.
